subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
Original meaning was apparently “edge”. Related to {{och-l|漘|bank of a river}}, {{och-l|宸|eave (i.e. edge of a roof)}} and {{och-l|胗|ulcer of the lip}} ({{zh-ref|Wang, 1982}}).

Further etymology is not clear. The various theories are:
* {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}}: Related to {{cog|lep|ᰣᰌᰫᰯ|tr=a-dul||lips}} < root {{m|lep|ᰌᰫᰯ|tr=dul}} ({{zh-ref|STEDT}} derives this from {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*m-ts(j)ul||lip; beak}}).
* {{zh-ref|Benedict (1972)}}: Related to {{cog|bo|མཆུ||lips; beak of a bird}} (derived from the same Sino-Tibetan [[etymon]] in {{zh-ref|STEDT}}).
